page.title: 13The Station in Wolverhampton
page.content: Situated just outside the centre of Wolverhampton is the railway station.It plays a major part in the transport system.The station has easy access to London,Birmingham,Manchester and Glasgow. There used to be two stations but during the 1960s the other,Low Level, became less used.In 1969 the regular services ended and there were only trains to Birmingham.In 1972 the station finally closed down. The main reason for its closing was because more lines ran through the present station.High Level station was rebuilt and modernised in the late 1960s. Many people think that the older station should have been kept due to the fact that it was an example of good railway architecture with a domed roof.
